class type_forge.validators.composite.CompositeValidator(validators)[source]

Bases: type_forge.core.base.BaseValidator, Generic[T]

A validator that combines multiple validators.

Initialize a composite validator with a list of validator functions.

Parameters:

validators (List[Callable[[object], bool]]) – List of validator functions that take a value and return a boolean

Validate a value using all validators in the composite.

Parameters:

value (object) – The value to validate

Returns:

True if all validators return True, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

validate_with_detail(value)[source]

Validate the given value with detailed results.

Provides comprehensive validation information including specific violations and an optionally converted value. This implementation relies on the simple validate method, but subclasses may override for more detailed reporting.

This method demonstrates the recursive refinement principle by building detailed validation upon the simpler boolean validation. It also implements the “Errors as Values” principle by encapsulating failures in the return type rather than through exceptions.

Parameters:

value (object) – The value to validate

Returns:

Detailed validation results with type preservation

Return type:

ValidationResult[object]

Raises:

  • No direct exceptions, but captures exceptions from validate() and –

  • converts them to ValidationResult with appropriate violations –

validate_with_details(value, path='$')[source]

Validate with detailed result information.

Parameters:

  • value (object) – The value to validate

  • path (str) – The path to report in case of violations

Returns:

A ValidationResult with detailed information

Return type:

Check if a collection has a valid length.

Parameters:

  • min_length (Optional[int]) – Minimum allowed length (inclusive), or None for no minimum

  • max_length (Optional[int]) – Maximum allowed length (inclusive), or None for no maximum

Returns:
